Asian Best Women's Football Team for 2003 Selected
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- The Asian Football Federation selected the Asian men and women best teams for this year on December 10.
 The DPRK women's football team was selected as the Asian best women's team for 2003.

articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Visits Revolutionary Museum
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited the Revolutionary History Museum of the Ministry of Railways on December 19 on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 86th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero.
 They looked round relics and materials on display and the hall where rolling stock including a train coach associated with their history are preserved.    
 Iranian Military Attache Abdullah Hamidi Benam who is doyen of the corps made an entry in the visitor's book. He wrote that the exploits of Kim Jong Suk will always be remembered by the Korean people and other people of the world, wishing the Korean people victory and glory under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.content:
Diplomatic Relations Established between DPRK and Ireland
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- A report on opening the diplomatic relations between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the Republic of Ireland was published on Dec. 20.
 According to the report, to this end official talks took place in Pyongyang on Dec. 10, 2003 between the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Ireland.    
 At the talks the documents on the opening of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Ireland were exchanged and it was agreed to establish the diplomatic relations between the two countries on Dec. 10, 2003 on the basis of the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations and Consular Relations.
